department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Sancai glazed pottery model of a tray and six attached bowls (a); two bowls have become deattached (b-c); tray unglazed at center with spotty brown and green glazing at rim; bowls have similar brown and green glazing at top and are unglazed at bottom; no storage box.
medium:
San-ts'ai ware
Earthenware with three-color glaze
text: Intended for the tomb, this offering set would have held special food offerings for the spirit of the deceased. At times the brightly colored <I>san-ts'ai<I> glazes were used in pairs to give a mottled effect. The lead-fluxed glazes co-mingled readily imparting a somewhat relaxed, natural effect like the one seen here on these perfectly formed matching containers and their tray.
title: Offering Set
